justification: The chapter notes that Grecucci et al. (2013) "instructed participants to up- and down-regulate … in the context of an ultimatum game" where they "decided whether to accept the offer," using acceptance of unfair or fair splits to index decision making.

In describing Gilead et al. (2016), the text explains that participants "viewed affective images while taking their own perspective or that of another named person and rate their affective reactions," making this image-based perspective-taking paradigm the operational measure of reappraisal effectiveness.
